Articles.Content:
Bubbadevlin Presents

The V2 Replica

DOWNLOAD

"The V-2 (German: Vergeltungswaffe 2, "Retribution Weapon 2"), technical name Aggregat-4 (A-4), was the world's first long-range[4] guided ballistic missile. The missile with a liquid-propellant rocket engine was developed during the Second World War in Germany as a "vengeance weapon", designed to attack Allied cities as retaliation for the Allied bombings against German cities. The V-2 rocket also became the first artificial object to cross the boundary of space with the vertical launch of V-177 on 20 June 1944.[5]" - Wikipedia


I created this replica to be as accurate as possible, down to the paint job. It was my first attempt ever at "painting" a rocket, and to be honest the first true replica rocket I have built. (Apollo Mission coming soon!) I learned a lot from it. To "paint" it, i used empty heat shields, as well as backward antennas, which are the only true black parts (not grey, like ore tanks).

 

The craft is however roughly 300 parts, and lags A TON. Also due to ascetics the rocket is no where near it real weight, (a lot more) it is just a replica of size, shape, and looks. I have been really lazy to get this out, and I have FINALLY (lets see if its out before 12) gotten around to releasing it. Have fun flying!
Damn, that is one beautiful rocket. How far is its range?
Hey man, how many antennas are there? If you use too many it creates mega lag.

Majorjim: Lets just say alot... Its really just a showroom thing, it lags a ton

 

pTrevTrevs: Idk really the range, although it is less than the real life version. Even empty heat shields are heavy!

Just now, Bubbadevlin said:

Majorjim: Lets just say alot... Its really just a showroom thing, it lags a ton

 

pTrevTrevs: Idk really the range, although it is less than the real life version. Even empty heat shields are heavy!

Fair enough man, I am not adverse to a high part count for detail sake! Do you have Kronal Vessel Viewer? It can show a lot more detail if that's what you want to show off.
Yea, i am aware of KVV, and i tried it for a pic of my original walker. It worked, however it lagged my editor so much i uninstalled it.

Just now, Bubbadevlin said:

Yea, i am aware of KVV, and i tried it for a pic of my original walker. It worked, however it lagged my editor so much i uninstalled it. 

Yeah you have to exit the VAB/SPH after you use it. That stops the lag.

Wow.

That's a lot of antennae. The last time I used so many (I was painting the underside of a shuttle black), my game crashed and I had to reinstall it. Nice work/insanity!
Amazing!  My V2 was just fairing colored.  It's a very tricky shape to replicate exactly.
